Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.ui.cli

Class CLI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.ui.cli.CLI
All Implemented Interfaces:
Ui
public class CLI
extends java.lang.Object
implements Ui
CLI user interface. Holds all the methods to get and parse the user input.

    • getIdResourcePair

      public javafx.util.Pair<Id,​Resource> getIdResourcePair​(boolean strongbox)
      Asks user for a resource (quantity + type) and its source/destination (depots and strongbox) and checks the input against an appropriate regex.
      Parameters:
      strongbox - if the player is allowed to access the strongbox
      Returns:
      the depot or strongbox id and the selected resource.

    • getResource

      public Resource getResource​(int max)
      Asks user input for a resource (quantity + type) and checks the input against a regex.
      Parameters:
      max - the maximum valid quantity that the player can input.
      Returns:
      the corresponding resource object.

    • parseResource

      private Resource parseResource​(java.lang.String number, java.lang.String type)
      Takes the two parts of the string representing a resource and returns the resource object. Expects the strings to be correct.
      Parameters:
      number - represents quantity.
      type - represents resource type
      Returns:
      returns the parsed resource object.

    • parseId

      private Id parseId​(java.lang.String id, Resource type)
      Parses a string corresponding to an ID.
      Parameters:
      id - identifier string.
      type - type of the resource selected alongside the ID to identify the strongbox.
      Returns:
      the depot or strongbox ID.

    • getDevelopmentRowCol

      public int[] getDevelopmentRowCol()
      Asks the user the color and level of a development card.
      Returns:
      an array of two int identifying row and column in the development card market matrix.

    • getChoice

      public int getChoice​(java.lang.String[] options, boolean enableRefresh, boolean isMenu, boolean interruptible)
      Asks the player for a choice amongst the possible option presented to them. The method, when called when the proper parameters, can be interrupted in order to refresh the options visible to the player (e.g. because it is now their turn). To do so, it spawns an extra thread that uses the blocking hasNextInt() method in its stead. It's usually called via its two overloaded methods.
      Parameters:
      options - Text for each options. Its length is used to determine the possible inputs.
      enableRefresh - true the last time this method was called it was interrupted (and therefore the spawned thread is still waiting for input)
      isMenu - whether the method calling this one is a menu (and therefore knows how to handle a 0 return value).
      interruptible - whether or not this execution of the method can be interrupted.
      Returns:
      either the chosen option number, 0 if the options need to be refreshed, or 1492 if we wish to end the game.

    • getChoice

      public int getChoice​(java.lang.String[] options)
      Calls the normal, non interruptible version of the method.
      Parameters:
      options - Options amongst which to choose.
      Returns:
      the option chosen (or the 1492 option).

    • getChoice

      public int getChoice​(java.lang.String[] options, boolean enableRefresh, boolean isMenu)
      Calls the interruptible version of the method.
      Parameters:
      options - Options amongst which to choose.
      enableRefresh - whether or not it has been refreshed the last time it was called (usually set to true by the case 0 of the menu switch)
      isMenu - whether or not the caller handles the 0 option.
      Returns:
      either the chosen option number, 0 if the options need to be refreshed, or 1492 if we wish to end the game.

    • getString

      public java.lang.String getString​(java.lang.String regex, java.lang.String desc)
      General input request that matches the input against the supplied regex until a correct input has been supplied. Used for the nickname and internally by the other input methods.
      Parameters:
      regex - regex to check against.
      desc - description of the required format.
      Returns:
      an input string that matches the regex.

    • getYesOrNo

      public boolean getYesOrNo​(java.lang.String desc)
      Asks the player for a yes or no answer.
      Parameters:
      desc - yes or no question to be printed.
      Returns:
      boolean corresponding to the chosen input.

    • getInt

      public int getInt​(int lower, int upper)
      Asks the player for a number inside a range. Loops until the input is acceptable.
      Parameters:
      lower - upper limit of the range (included)
      upper - lower limit of the range (included)
      Returns:
      the selected valid int.

    • start

      public void start()
      Prints the banner, initializes the message handler and launches the MenuRunner.
      Specified by:
      start in interface Ui
